ramantools module

ramantools.plotspec(xrobject, width, height, shift)[source]

plotspec plots a Raman map at a given Raman shift and displays alongside a selected spectrum at a specified width and height. First variable is a ramanmap object, followed by the specific width and height coordinates for the single spectrum.

Returns

none

Parameters

  • xrobject (xarray DataArray) – This is a Raman map

  • width (float) – ‘width’ coordinate in um, from xrobject

  • height (float) – ‘height’ coordinate in um, from xrobject

  • shift (float) – ‘ramanshift’ coordinate in um, from xrobject

class ramantools.ramanmap(map_path, info_path)[source]

Bases: object

Container for Raman maps, imported from a text file. The text file needs to be exported as a “table” from Witec Project or Witec Control. Additional info also needs to be exported, containing the metadata for the measurement. This is the text next to the map data in the Witec software.

Returns

object containing the data and metadata

Return type

ramanmap object

Parameters

  • map_path (str) – Path to the text file, containing the Raman map, exported from Witec

  • info_path (str) – Path to the info file, containing the metadata, exported from Witec

print_metadata()[source]

Prints the imported metadata, loaded from the info file.

class ramantools.singlespec(spec_path, info_path)[source]

Bases: object

Container for Raman single spectra, imported from a text file.

The text file needs to be exported as a “table” from Witec Project or Witec Control Additional info also needs to be exported, containing the metadata for the measurement. This is the text next to the map data in the Witec software. It takes two arguments, the first is the path to the file containing the spectroscopy data, the second is the path to the metadata.

print_metadata()[source]

Prints the metadata of the singlespec object.
